title: [BUG] in colab, pip install sktime hangs after statsmodels download for `scipy=1.8.0`

labels.name: maintenance
labels.description: Continuous integration, unit testing & package distribution

body:
Update by @fkiraly: the issue seems to be resolved by the introduction of the upper bound `scipy<1.8.0` in `sktime` v0.10.1, as suspected. The bug is probably still there for `scipy 1.8.0`, and we should understand how to resolve it in order to relax the upper bound again.

---
**Describe the bug**
<!--
-->
I've tried to pip install sktime in Google Colab but it hangs and installation doesn't complete

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Jus use this in Google Colab:
-->

```python
!pip install sktime
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->
The issue seems to be related to the upgrade of statsmodels to 0.13.2.
However, I can run:
```python
!pip install statsmodels
```
which correctly installs that version of the library
